DOC.brief_summary: This study is a comparison of two techniques for endotracheal intubation (Glidescope versus Macintosh) in patients with odontogenic abscesses.
DOC.brief_title: Intubation of Patients With Odontogenic Abcesses
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with odontogenic abcesses have to be treated by surgical drainage of the abscess under general intubation with endotracheal intubation. Because of a limited mouth opening and swelling within the oral cavity, intubation can be difficult and sometimes impossible with conventional direct laryngoscopy. Therefore, alternative techniques are desirable. We want to compare the success rate of intubation in these patients using the Glidescope technique vs. conventional Macintosh technique.
DOC.criteria: Patients have to have an abscess which has to be treated surgically. Mouth opening (Interincisor gap) has to be less than 3.5 cm and more than 1.4 cm. Age under 18 years.
DOC.keyword: Difficult intubations in patients with odontogenic abscesses
